xxl.core.collections.queues.io
Class RandomAccessFileQueue<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.queues.AbstractQueue<E>
      xxl.core.collections.queues.io.StreamQueue<E>
          xxl.core.collections.queues.io.RandomAccessFileQueue<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of the elements of this queue.
All Implemented Interfaces:
FIFOQueue<E>, Queue<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CounterRandomAccessFileQueue
public class RandomAccessFileQueue<E>
extends StreamQueue<E>
implements FIFOQueue<E>

This class provides a stream queue that stores the bytes of its serialized elements in a random access file. The peek method is not implemented by this queue. A converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.

The queue only uses a window of the file. The file is always growing with further insertions. So, be careful not to use a queue too long.
Example usage (1). 

     // create a new file

     File file = new File("queue.dat");

     // create a new random access file queue with ...

     RandomAccessFileQueue queue = new RandomAccessFileQueue(

         // the created file

         file,

         // an integer converter

         IntegerConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE,

         // an input buffer size of 4 bytes

         new Constant(4),

         // an output buffer size of 4 bytes

         new Constant(4)
     );
     
     // opent the queue
 
     queue.open();
 
     // insert the integers from 0 to 9 into the queue

     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++)
         queue.enqueue(new Integer(i));

     // print 5 elements of the queue

     int i = 0;
     while (i < 5 && !queue.isEmpty()) {
         i = ((Integer)queue.dequeue()).intValue();
         System.out.println(i);
     }

     // insert the integers from 20 to 29 into the queue

     for (i = 20; i < 30; i++)
         queue.enqueue(new Integer(i));

     // print all elements of the queue

     while (!queue.isEmpty())
          System.out.println(queue.dequeue());

     // close and clear the queue after use

     queue.close();
     queue.clear();

See Also:
Queue, StreamQueue, FIFOQueue, File, RandomAccessFile

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function<Object,RandomAccessFileQueue<Convertable>> FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method to create a new RandomAccessFileQueue (see contract for FACTORY_METHOD in interface Queue). In contradiction to the contract in Queue it may only be invoked with a parameter list (for further details see Function) of objects. The parameter list will be used for initializing the random access file queue by calling the constructor RandomAccessFileQueue((File) list.get(0), (Function)list.get(1), new Constant(0), new Constant(0)).

See Also:
Function

filename

protected String filename
A file of this name is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.

file

protected File file
One constructor uses a File object (to use temporary files). Therefore, the queue works in two modes, the filename mode an the file mode.

randomAccessFile

protected RandomAccessFile randomAccessFile
A random access file stream for reading from and writing to file. The stream is created by invoking openFile with file when the file stack queue is opened.

fso

protected FilesystemOperations fso
Contains an object which is responsible for the operations on files.

readOffset

protected long readOffset
The offset from the beginning of the file, in bytes, at which the next serialized element of this queue is stored.

Constructor Detail

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(String filename,
                             FilesystemOperations fso,
                             Converter<E> converter,
                             Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize,
                             Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize,
                             Function<?,? extends InputStream> newInputStream,
                             Function<?,? extends OutputStream> newOutputStream)
Constructs a new random access file that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the openFile-method of the filesystem determined by fso. Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
fso - the filesystem on which the file is created.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
newInputStream - a function (factory-method) that returns a new input stream used for reading data.
newOutputStream - a function (factory-method) that returns a new output stream used for writing data.

RandomAccessFileQueue

                             Converter<E> converter,
                             Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize,

The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(String filename,
                             Converter<E> converter,
                             Function<?,? extends E> newObject,
                             Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize,
                             Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new random access file queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the openFile-method of JavaFilesystemOperations. Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. The specified converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.

Parameters:
filename - the name of the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.

RandomAccessFileQueue

public RandomAccessFileQueue(File file,
                             Converter<E> converter,
                             Function<?,? extends E> newObject,
                             Function<?,Integer> inputBufferSize,
                             Function<?,Integer> outputBufferSize)
Constructs a new random access file queue that stores its elements in the given file. When opening the queue, the file is opened for random access by calling the constructor RandomAccessFile(file, "rw"). Therefore objects that are stored into the file are used for initializing the queue. A convertable converter is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue and the specified factory method is used for initializing these elements before the file is read out. The given functions are used for determining the size of the input and ouput buffer.

Parameters:
file - the file that is internally used for storing the elements of the queue.
converter - a converter that is used for serializing and de-serializing the elements of the queue
newObject - a factory method that is used for initializing the elements of the queue before the file is read out.
inputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the input buffer.
outputBufferSize - a function that determines the size of the output buffer.
See Also:
ConvertableConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE
Method Detail

open

public void open()
Opens the random access file queue for the access to elements of this queue. This method is called implicitly every time the inputStream or outputStream method is called. This implementation checks whether a random access file stream already exists. When no such stream exists, openFile is invoked with file and the elements that are stored in the file after opening it for random access are used as initial elements of the queue.

Specified by:
open in interface Queue<E>
Overrides:
open in class AbstractQueue<E>

clear

public void clear()
Removes all elements from this queue. The queue will be empty after this call returns so that size() == 0.
This implementation simply closes the queue, deletes the internally used file and sets size to 0.

Specified by:
clear in interface Queue<E>
Overrides:
clear in class StreamQueue<E>

close

public void close()
Closes this queue and releases any system resources associated with it. This operation is idempotent, i.e., multiple calls of this method takes the same effect as a single call.
This implementation closes the random access file and deletes the file if it is empty. Therefore the queue can be reopened later and will have the same state as before closing it, when openFile does not affect the elements stored in the file.

Specified by:
close in interface Queue<E>
Overrides:
close in class StreamQueue<E>

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use a RandomAccessFileQueue. It can also be used to test the functionality of a RandomAccessFileQueue.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
